intro: Sameraria odontogera, commonly known as the toothed sameraria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Sameraria odontogera is typically found in moist, shaded environments within forest understories.
